intro: Scaphochlamys breviscapa, commonly known as the short-cupped orchid, is a species of orchid native to the mountainous regions of Southeast Asia. It is characterized by its compact, pseudobulbous structure and produces small, showy flowers in shades of white and pink. The plant typically grows in shaded, humid environments, often in forest understories. Its flowers are borne on slender stems and are known for their intricate, fragrant morphology. Scaphochlamys breviscapa is a rare and specialized species, requiring specific ecological conditions for successful cultivation.
